metadata.title: CVE-2017-15591 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Xen 4.5.x through 4.9.x allowing attackers (whocontrol a stub domain kernel or tool stack) to cause a denial of service(host OS crash) because of a missing comparison (of range start to rangeend) within the DMOP map/unmap implementation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15591` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.5 - 4.6.4-0ubuntu1.4
libxenstore3.0 - 4.6.4-0ubuntu1.4
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.6.4-0ubuntu1.4
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.6.4-0ubuntu1.4
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.6.4-0ubuntu1.4
xen-hypervisor-4.5-amd64 - 4.6.4-0ubuntu1.4
xen-hypervisor-4.5-arm64 - 4.6.4-0ubuntu1.4
xen-hypervisor-4.5-armhf - 4.6.4-0ubuntu1.4
xen-system-amd64 - 4.6.4-0ubuntu1.4
xen-system-arm64 - 4.6.4-0ubuntu1.4
xen-system-armhf - 4.6.4-0ubuntu1.4
xen-utils-4.5 - 4.6.4-0ubuntu1.4
xen-utils-common - 4.6.4-0ubuntu1.4
xenstore-utils - 4.6.4-0ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.6.4-0ubuntu1.4').
